articles.title: Particulate matter levels in air exceed WHO limits in majority of world's big cities
articles.description: Fewer than one in five global cities met World Health Organization air pollution standards in 2024 with Central and South Asia accounting for the nine most polluted metropolitan areas on Earth, six of which were in India
articles.content: People brave "severe plus" smog shrouding New Delhi, India, on November 15 when the National Capital Region's Air Quality Index hit 424, according to the Central Pollution Control Board. A below-50 reading means air quality is good. Anything over 300... [3702 chars]

articles.title: WATCH: Vinod Kambli’s jubilant dance to the song ‘Chak De India’ goes viral amidst his recovery from a critical health issue
articles.description: Former India cricketer Vinod Kambli displayed his dance moves amidst health woes due to alcoholism. Kambli's doctor provided an important health update after former Indian cricketer was diagnosed with brain clots.
articles.content: Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli is currently fighting a crucial battle on the health front as he was admitted to the Akruti Health City Hospital in Thane after a high-grade fever. But like a true sports person, Kambli has decided to battle it ou... [1618 chars]

articles.title: Vinod Kambli breaks silence on health struggles, thanks his wife Andrea and friend Sachin Tendulkar
articles.description: Vinod Kambli opened up about his health struggles and credited his family and childhood friend for their full support. Kambli played more than 100 ODIs for India.
articles.content: Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli, who has recently made headlines due to his health issues, has opened up about his struggles and the critical role played by his family and his close friend cricketing legend Sachin Tendulkar. Kambli revealed the ... [1987 chars]

articles.title: Athletes see climate change as threatening their sports and their health. Some are speaking up
articles.description: Pragnya Mohan has been a professional triathlete for nearly a decade, but summers in her native India are now so hot that she can’t train there anymore.
articles.content: BAKU, Azerbaijan (AP) — Pragnya Mohan has been a professional triathlete for nearly a decade, but summers in her native India are now so hot that she can’t train there anymore. She escaped the heat to train in the United Kingdom, but worries about a ... [5227 chars]

articles.title: Smog sickness: India's capital struggles as pollution surges

articles.title: Pakistan province calls for ‘climate diplomacy’ with India as record smog chokes major city
articles.description: A smog-choked province in eastern Pakistan has issued a rare plea for cross-border collaboration with India, as major cities in both countries endure severe air pollution that risks the health of millions.
articles.content:
Islamabad, Pakistan CNN —
A smog-choked province in eastern Pakistan has issued a rare plea for cross-border collaboration with India, as major cities in both countries endure severe air pollution that risks the health of millions.

articles.title: River and air pollution in India's capital pose a severe health threat to residents
articles.description: One of India’s most sacred rivers, the Yamuna in New Delhi, is covered with white toxic foam, with vast sections frothing as a result of pollutants discharged from industries around the city.
articles.content: NEW DELHI (AP) — One of India’s most sacred rivers, the Yamuna in New Delhi, is covered with white toxic foam, with vast sections frothing as a result of pollutants discharged from industries around the city. The pollution poses a severe health threa... [6711 chars]

articles.title: Indian capital chokes as 'hazardous' air pollution returns
articles.description: Acrid clouds engulfed India's capital on Wednesday as air pollution fuelled by fireworks and farm stubble burning was ranked "hazardous" by monitors for the first time this winter.Commuters walking to work cough through poisonous smog that kills thousands each year, according to health experts, alth...

articles.title: India's Star Health confirms data breach after cybercriminals post customers' health data online
articles.description: The insurance giant confirmed a data breach, weeks after cybercriminals posted alleged customer health and medical data online.
articles.content: Star Health and Allied Insurance, one of the largest health insurance firms in India, has confirmed it was the target of a “malicious cyberattack,” some two weeks after cybercriminals claimed to post customers’ health records and other sensitive data... [2983 chars]
